example.description: This demo shows the portal element containing some widgets. Drag docklets to a column of choice and check out the settings panel. For demo purpose this implementation is spread out over many files. This makes loading the portal slower than it would in a real production environment. The userdata.xml file are the settings of the user that is logged in. These settings should come from a permanent data store (on the server or locally). They can easily be saved back because this is the data the portal element is bound on.
example.source: <a:portal id="portal1" columns = "30%, 40%, 30%" height = "520" model = "demo/elements/portal/userdata.xml"> <a:each match="[docklet]"> <a:src match="[@src]" /> <a:collapsed match="[node()[@collapsed='true']]" value="1" /> <a:column value="[@column]" /> <a:caption match="[@name]" /> </a:each> </a:portal>
